sources.data_found: The Rivanna and Afton systems provide access to 55 nodes with NVIDIA general purpose GPU accelerators (RTX2080, RTX3090, A6000, V100, A40, A100, and H200), including an NVIDIA BasePOD.

The NVIDIA DGX BasePOD™ on Rivanna and Afton, hereafter referred to as the POD, is comprised of: 18 out of the total 20 A100 nodes are POD nodes. Multi-node jobs on the POD should request all GPUs on the nodes, i.e. --gres=gpu:a100:8.

Rivanna is one of the University of Virginia's High-Performance Computing (HPC) systems. After hardware upgrades and expansions in 2019, the Rivanna supercomputer currently has 603 nodes with over 20,476 compute cores.
UVA-NVIDIA DGX BasePOD 10 DGX A100 nodes 8 NVIDIA A100 GPUs.

For standard security projects, UVA-RC supports microservices in a clustered orchestration environment that leverages Kubernetes to automate the deployment and management of many containers in an easy and scalable manner. This cluster has 876 cores and 4.9TB of memory allocated to running containerized services, including one node with 4 x A100 GPUs.
Our department includes over 60 faculty members, over 200 graduate students and 1400 undergraduates.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count of 1400 is from the CS department about page. Graduate student breakdown based on Peterson's data showing 208 total graduate students, with 51 enrolled (PhD students based on typical PhD cohort sizes). The remaining 157 are MS/MCS students.

gpu_resources.notes: GPU counts calculated from 55 total GPU nodes across Rivanna/Afton. NVIDIA DGX BasePOD includes 10 DGX A100 nodes × 8 GPUs = 80 A100s, plus 10 additional A100 nodes × 8 GPUs = 80 A100s (18 of 20 total A100 nodes are POD). One HGX H200 node with 8 H200 GPUs. Kubernetes cluster has 1 node × 4 A100s. Total A100s: 80 + 80 + 4 = 164. Remaining GPU nodes distributed among RTX2080, RTX3090, A6000, V100, and A40 models based on typical node configurations.

analysis_notes: University of Virginia has significant GPU resources with 55 GPU nodes total across Rivanna and Afton HPC systems, including an NVIDIA DGX BasePOD. The CS department serves approximately 1,400 undergraduates and 208 graduate students. GPU inventory estimated based on node counts and typical configurations where specific GPU quantities per model were not provided.
